channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish/litter, 18th February
item.description:
You have said the Rubbish issue has been sorted out from my last Fix My Street contact (attached photo) How come the rubbish is all still there! Your staff need to actually walk around the Close & look as rubbish doesn't just gather at an entrance of a Road ... there's also a back green space covered in litter which I usually pick up as nobody from Bromley ever comes to litter pick here but I am unable to at the moment as I have health issues. Please let me know if you would like to take money off my Council Tax Bills for picking up litter & doing the job of your operatives or if Bromley Council are going to send on a regular basis a Street Cleaner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bredhurst Close, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Forest bikes, 18th February
item.description:
There are many abandoned bikes along Anchor & Hope Lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Anchor And Hope Lane, Charlton Riverside, Greater London

Large fly tip here and surrounding area on both sides of the main road needs a good clean.

item.title: Westmoor Street full of holes, 18th February
item.description:
Westmoor Street full of holes. Serious Hole. Car damaging holes. Please sort it out. Please also stop people parking by the junctions restricting vision. You can't see when you pull out and are liable to be hit by a speeding skip truck.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westmoor Street, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incomplete, abandoned scaffolding creating a significant trip hazard and security risk for residents, 18th February
item.description:
Scaffolding installation was abandoned mid-way several weeks ago, leaving an incomplete structure that creates a significant trip hazard and a security risk (climbing hazard). The area is currently unsafe and lacks proper contractor oversight. Requesting immediate completion or removal

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no.13 Karma bread, 18th February
item.description:
There is loose pavement slab and people having been tripping over and has been going on for week. Also loose slabs outside Mitsuya also
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15-17, South End Road, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scaffolding obstructing building access and blocking external lighting since January 2026, 18th February
item.description:
Obstruction and accessibility issue at the entrance of Bew Court. Scaffolding installed in January remains on-site, partially blocking the main access route and creating a hazard for residents. It lacks required safety signage at the base and is currently obstructing the external lighting it was intended to repair. Requesting urgent removal to clear the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken, wobbly paving stone on pavement outside 4 Georgette Place, 18th February
item.description:
Broken paving stone, uneven and insecure surface.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): King George Street, Greenwich

item.title: Vomit on the stairwell, 18th February
item.description:
Someone has thrown up on the stairwell quite a lot and not bothered to clean it up. It's on the first set of stairs in the building
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lordship Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Serious Potholes Westbound on Bellegrove Road in the vicinity of the traffic islands, 18th February
item.description:
Serious Potholes Westbound on Bellegrove Road in the vicinity of the traffic islands once you get beyond Shoulder of Mutton Green. You can't swerve them or you hit the islands.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering request on Friary Road, 18th February
item.description:
Please can someone actually pick up all this litter. This glove for example has been here since before Christmas. I've requested litter pick up's at least 3 times since then but nothing is done. Serious enquiries need to be made about the lack of litter control in this area and poor quality of work being done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Friary Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kyverdale Road, Hackney, London

item.title: The paving slabs outside Pet Perfection Queensway are in a dreadful state, protruding out of the ground extremely dangerous. A very bad accident is waiting to happen., 18th February
item.description:
Many paving slabs are uneven and sticking out of the ground, this problem has been there for many months!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crest View Drive, Petts Wood, Greater London

item.title: Lots of litter in and around the grass patch on Elcot Avenue, 18th February
item.description:
Can someone please come into this area and do a full clean up job? So many thrown beer cans, bottles and other waste really ruining this little green space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Friary Road, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: Street litter picking required along Friary Road, 18th February
item.description:
From Elcot Avenue to Goldsmith Road, Friary Road is full of street litter. Please can this all been removed. It's been here for months, I can see it's the same bits of litter even!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127, Friary Road, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: Bed headboards flytipped on Elcot Avenue Grass area behind bench, 18th February
